[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Minimum Check Bypass] At line 357, minimum is calculated as mul_with_oracle_price(total_shares, 1) - can an attacker add rewards when total_shares is manipulated to be low? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_new_reward_type()] [Bag Add Failure] At line 245, bag.add might fail if TypeName already exists - is this properly checked or can it cause state inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: remove_reward_buffer_distribution()] [Table Remove] At line 326, table.remove is called - does this properly clean up all associated state or leave dangling references? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: reward_balance()] [Bag Borrow Safety] At line 717, bag.borrow is called without checking if TypeName exists - can this panic if reward type wasn't added? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: reward_amount()] [Table Access] At line 724, table.borrow is called directly - is there error handling if the reward type doesn't exist? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: remove_reward_buffer_distribution()] [VecMap Remove] At line 327, distributions.remove is called - does this maintain order consistency for other operations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [VecMap Get/Mut] At lines 578 and 580, both get and get_mut are used - can this cause issues with borrow checker or state consistency? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_receipt_reward()] [Keys Iteration] At line 654, reward_indices.keys() returns vector for iteration - is this gas-efficient for many reward types? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Freeze Check Order] At line 349, assert_operator_not_freezed is called after vault_id check - should freeze check come first to prevent any state reading? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: set_reward_rate()] [Freeze Bypass] At line 425, freeze check is done but rate update happens at line 437 - can operator status change between these lines? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Vault Enable Check] At line 603, vault.assert_enabled() checks vault status - but what if vault becomes disabled during the claim execution? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: create_reward_manager()] [Vault Association] At line 174, vault.set_reward_manager links them - can this be called multiple times to change reward_manager_id? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Vault ID Check] At line 348, vault_id matching is checked - but is the vault_id immutable or can it be changed maliciously? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Vault Coupling] Multiple functions check vault_id at lines 318, 348, 388, 424, 455, 473, 605, 673 - is this check sufficient or can vault be swapped? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Rate Zero Handling] At line 483, if rate is 0, only last_updated changes - can this be exploited to skip reward periods without distributing? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Rate Calculation] At line 498, new_reward uses rate * time_delta - is there overflow protection for extremely large rates or time gaps? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: set_reward_rate()] [Rate Upper Bound] At line 428, rate must be < u256::max / 86_400_000 - but is this tight enough to prevent all overflow scenarios in line 498? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: set_reward_rate()] [Rate Zero Setting] Can rate be set to 0 at line 437, and does this permanently stop distribution even if buffer has rewards? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Share Check] At line 568, total_shares must be > 0 - but what if all shares are burned after this check but before index calculation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Share Minimum] At line 356, minimum reward depends on total_shares - can an attacker manipulate shares to bypass the minimum? (High)
